deleteAllAssetsContainer.description: Delete all containers from world state, supports filters

___AssetKey.description: This container's world state container ID

___compliant.description: This container has no active alerts

___state.description: Properties that have been received or calculated for this container

___prefix.description: The container's asset class prefix in world state

___eventin.description: The contract event that created this state, for example updateAssetContainer

___eventout.description: The chaincode event emitted on invoke exit, if any

___assetIDpath.description: Qualified property path to the container's ID, declared in the contract code

readAllAssetsContainer.description: Returns the state of all containers, supports filters

$eref.description: Array of container states, can mix asset classes

deleteAssetContainer.description: Delete a container from world state, transactions remain on the blockchain

createAssetContainer.description: Creates a new container (e.g. put new)

$eref.description: The changeable properties for a container, also considered its 'event' as a partial state

___temperature.description: Temperature of a container's contents in degrees Celsuis

___carrier.description: The carrier in possession of this container

replaceAssetContainer.description: Replaces a container's state (e.g. put existing)

$eref.description: The changeable properties for a container, also considered its 'event' as a partial state

___temperature.description: Temperature of a container's contents in degrees Celsuis

___carrier.description: The carrier in possession of this container

updateAssetContainer.description: Update a contaner's state with one or more property changes (e.g. patch existing)

$eref.description: The changeable properties for a container, also considered its 'event' as a partial state

___temperature.description: Temperature of a container's contents in degrees Celsuis

___carrier.description: The carrier in possession of this container

readAssetStateHistoryContainer.description: Returns history states for a container

$eref.description: Array of container states, can mix asset classes

deletePropertiesFromAssetContainer.description: Delete one or more properties from a container's state, an example being temperature, which is only relevant for sensitive (as in frozen) shipments

deleteAssetStateHistoryContainer.description: Delete a container's history from world state, transactions remain on the blockchain

container.description: The changeable properties for a container, also considered its 'event' as a partial state

___temperature.description: Temperature of a container's contents in degrees Celsuis

___carrier.description: The carrier in possession of this container

containerstatearray.description: Array of container states, can mix asset classes

___^CON.description: The external state of one container asset, named by its world state ID

___compliant.description: This container has no active alerts

___prefix.description: The container's asset class prefix in world state

___eventout.description: The chaincode event emitted on invoke exit, if any

___assetIDpath.description: Qualified property path to the container's ID, declared in the contract code
